meanings.definition: A line where two pieces of fabric are sewn together.
meanings.sent1: I can see the seams on my shirt where the pieces of fabric meet.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully stitched the seams of the dress to ensure it holds together.
meanings.sent3: The seams on the pillowcase were so neat, it looked like a professional job.
meanings.sent4: Her life story was like a patchwork quilt, each seam representing a different chapter.
meanings.sent5: The seams on the baseball were fraying, showing its age and use.

meanings.definition: A line where two edges or sides meet.
meanings.sent1: The seams of the book cover were starting to come apart from frequent use.
meanings.sent2: The seams of the puzzle pieces fit perfectly together, creating a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent3: The seams of the road met at a sharp turn, making it a challenging drive.
meanings.sent4: The seams of the mountain range created a stunning silhouette against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The seams of the envelope were sealed tightly to keep the letter safe.

meanings.definition: To join or attach by sewing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully seams the patches onto her backpack to personalize it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor seams the hem of the dress to give it a clean finish.
meanings.sent3: He seams the pieces of the model airplane together with precision.
meanings.sent4: The artist seams different fabrics to create a unique tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The seamstress seams the lace onto the wedding gown, adding a delicate touch.
